title: How to Get All the Wings in Terraria

steps.headline: Get all craftable wings.
steps.description: To get all craftable wings, you need to get Souls of Flight. Start by getting up to a Sky bridge or Floating Island.

steps.headline: Wait until a Wyvern or Arch Wyvern appears.
steps.description: They look like long, serpentine dragons. Kill it to get Souls of Flight. The maximum number you'll need is 20.

steps.headline: Gather Souls of Night.
steps.description: You can do this by either continuously slaying enemies in the Harmode Crimson/Corruption. Combine 20 Souls of Flight, 25 Souls of Night, and 10 feathers (dropped by Harpies) at a Mythril Anvil to get Demon wings. An alternative method to find Souls of Night is to kill the Eater of Worlds continuously.

steps.headline: Visit the Underground Hallow.
steps.description: Kill all Illuminant enemies until you have 25 Souls of Light. Combine 20 Souls of Flight, the Souls of Light, and 10 Feathers at a Mythril Anvil to get Angel Wings. An easy method is to farm the slime king in the underground hallow.

steps.headline: Kill Ocram until you have 20 Souls of Blight.
steps.description: Combine 20 Souls of Flight and 10 feathers to get sparkly wings. This only applies to the Mobile/Console Version of Terraria. The Dryad sells Sparkly wings for 40 Gold on the night of a Blood Moon.

steps.headline: Obtain the Angler.
steps.description: Take on his quests, and he'll reward you with the Fin wings eventually.

steps.headline: Obtain the Steampunker.
steps.description: During the Waxing Moon phase, you can purchase the Jetpack for 40 Gold.

steps.headline: Kill Moss Hornets in the Underground Jungle during Hardmode.
steps.description: Eventually, they drop the Tattered Bee wing. Combine this at a Mythril Anvil with 20 Souls of Flight to get the Bee wings.

steps.headline: Kill Moths in the Underground Jungle/Hallow.
steps.description: Although they're rare, Moths have a 50% chance of dropping Butterfly Dust. Combine this with 20 Souls of Flight to get the Butterfly wings.

steps.headline: Kill Fairies in the Hallow.
steps.description: They drop 1-5 Pixie Dust. Get 100 Pixie Dust and combine it with 20 Souls of Flight to get Fairy wings.

steps.headline: Visit a Floating Island and hunt Harpies.
steps.description: They have a 1 in 200 chance of dropping the Giant Harpy Feather. Combine one with 20 Souls of Flight to obtain Harpy wings.

steps.headline: Defeat Plantera and Skeletron, and enter the Dungeon.
steps.description: Kill Armored Bones until they drop the Bone Feather. Combine the Bone Feather with 20 Souls of Flight to get Bone wings.

steps.headline: Wait for a Solar Eclipse and kill Vampires during the event.
steps.description: Vampires drop the Broken Bat Wing, which is combined with Souls of Flight to make Bat wings.

steps.headline: Get the Witch Doctor.
steps.description: Move him to a Jungle Biome and purchase the Leaf wings from him for 1 Platinum.

steps.headline: Wait until it rains in one of your Hardmode worlds that has a Snow biome.
steps.description: Find Snow Golems and hunt them until they drop an Ice Feather. Combine it with 20 Souls of Flight to get the Frozen wings.

steps.headline: Go to the Underworld.
steps.description: Kill Red Devils until you get a Fire Feather. Combine it with 20 Souls of Flight to get Flaming wings.

steps.headline: Defeat Plantera and Skeletron and visit the Dungeon.
steps.description: Kill 100 HP enemies until a Dungeon Spirit spawns. Kill them until you have 10 Ectoplasm, a 100% chance drop from them. Use a Mythril Anvil with 20 Souls of Flight to get Ghost wings.

steps.headline: Find the Lihzahard Temple and defeat Golem.
steps.description: One of his drops is the Beetle Husk, which you need 8 of. Combine it with 20 Souls of Flight to get Beetle wings.

steps.headline: Summon the Frost Moon (not to be confused with Frost Legion).
steps.description: Defeat the Everscream boss. One of its drops is the Festive wings.

steps.headline: Find the Truffle.
steps.description: After Plantera has been defeated in that world, the Truffle sells the Autohammer, which is solely used to craft Shroomite Bars. One takes 1 Chlorophyte Bar and 15 Glowing Mushrooms, and you need 18 bars, so in all you need 18 Chlorophyte Bars and 270 Glowing Mushrooms. Combine these with 20 Souls of Flight to get the Hoverboard.

steps.headline: Summon the Pumpkin Moon.
steps.description: Beat Mourning Wood until you get a Spooky Twig. Combine it with 20 Souls of Flight to get the spooky wings.

steps.headline: Summon a Pumpkin Moon.
steps.description: Defeat the Pumpkin boss until you get Black Fairy Dust. Combine it with Souls of Flight to get the tattered fairy wings.

steps.headline: Beat Duke Fishron.
steps.description: He has a 1 in 15 chance of dropping the Fishron wings.

steps.headline: Defeat the Lunatic Cultist.
steps.description: He spawns at the entrance of the dungeon once Golem is defeated. Destroy either the Stardust, Vortex, Nebula, or Solar pillars to get at least 14 fragments. Combine them with 10 Luminite Bars at an Ancient Manipulator to get the Vortex Booster, Stardust Wings, Nebula Mantle, or Solar Wings. Solar Wings are currently the strongest wings in Terraria. This only applies to the PC Version of Terraria.

steps.headline: Defeat Plantera and wait for a Solar Eclipse to occur.
steps.description: A large creature named Mothron will rarely spawn and will drop the Mothron Wings. This only applies to the PC Version of Terraria.

steps.headline: Defeat bosses while playing Expert Mode.
steps.description: They should drop a Treasure Bag. Rarely, developer reserved wings (such as Will's Wings, Yoraiz0r's Spell, and Skiphs's Paws) can be given. They no longer kill players. This only applies to the PC Version of Terraria.

text: Souls of Flight Get all craftable wings. To get all craftable wings, you need to get Souls of Flight. Start by getting up to a Sky bridge or Floating Island. Wait until a Wyvern or Arch Wyvern appears. They look like long, serpentine dragons. Kill it to get Souls of Flight. The maximum number you'll need is 20. Wings Gather Souls of Night. You can do this by either continuously slaying enemies in the Harmode Crimson/Corruption. Combine 20 Souls of Flight, 25 Souls of Night, and 10 feathers (dropped by Harpies) at a Mythril Anvil to get Demon wings. An alternative method to find Souls of Night is to kill the Eater of Worlds continuously. Visit the Underground Hallow. Kill all Illuminant enemies until you have 25 Souls of Light. Combine 20 Souls of Flight, the Souls of Light, and 10 Feathers at a Mythril Anvil to get Angel Wings. An easy method is to farm the slime king in the underground hallow. Kill Ocram until you have 20 Souls of Blight. Combine 20 Souls of Flight and 10 feathers to get sparkly wings. This only applies to the Mobile/Console Version of Terraria. The Dryad sells Sparkly wings for 40 Gold on the night of a Blood Moon. Obtain the Angler. Take on his quests, and he'll reward you with the Fin wings eventually. Obtain the Steampunker. During the Waxing Moon phase, you can purchase the Jetpack for 40 Gold. Kill Moss Hornets in the Underground Jungle during Hardmode. Eventually, they drop the Tattered Bee wing. Combine this at a Mythril Anvil with 20 Souls of Flight to get the Bee wings. Kill Moths in the Underground Jungle/Hallow. Although they're rare, Moths have a 50% chance of dropping Butterfly Dust. Combine this with 20 Souls of Flight to get the Butterfly wings. Kill Fairies in the Hallow. They drop 1-5 Pixie Dust. Get 100 Pixie Dust and combine it with 20 Souls of Flight to get Fairy wings. Visit a Floating Island and hunt Harpies. They have a 1 in 200 chance of dropping the Giant Harpy Feather. Combine one with 20 Souls of Flight to obtain Harpy wings. Defeat Plantera and Skeletron, and enter the Dungeon. Kill Armored Bones until they drop the Bone Feather. Combine the Bone Feather with 20 Souls of Flight to get Bone wings. Wait for a Solar Eclipse and kill Vampires during the event. Vampires drop the Broken Bat Wing, which is combined with Souls of Flight to make Bat wings. Get the Witch Doctor. Move him to a Jungle Biome and purchase the Leaf wings from him for 1 Platinum. Wait until it rains in one of your Hardmode worlds that has a Snow biome. Find Snow Golems and hunt them until they drop an Ice Feather. Combine it with 20 Souls of Flight to get the Frozen wings. Go to the Underworld. Kill Red Devils until you get a Fire Feather. Combine it with 20 Souls of Flight to get Flaming wings. Defeat Plantera and Skeletron and visit the Dungeon. Kill 100 HP enemies until a Dungeon Spirit spawns. Kill them until you have 10 Ectoplasm, a 100% chance drop from them. Use a Mythril Anvil with 20 Souls of Flight to get Ghost wings. Find the Lihzahard Temple and defeat Golem. One of his drops is the Beetle Husk, which you need 8 of. Combine it with 20 Souls of Flight to get Beetle wings. Summon the Frost Moon (not to be confused with Frost Legion). Defeat the Everscream boss. One of its drops is the Festive wings. Find the Truffle. After Plantera has been defeated in that world, the Truffle sells the Autohammer, which is solely used to craft Shroomite Bars. One takes 1 Chlorophyte Bar and 15 Glowing Mushrooms, and you need 18 bars, so in all you need 18 Chlorophyte Bars and 270 Glowing Mushrooms. Combine these with 20 Souls of Flight to get the Hoverboard. Summon the Pumpkin Moon. Beat Mourning Wood until you get a Spooky Twig. Combine it with 20 Souls of Flight to get the spooky wings. Summon a Pumpkin Moon. Defeat the Pumpkin boss until you get Black Fairy Dust. Combine it with Souls of Flight to get the tattered fairy wings. Beat Duke Fishron. He has a 1 in 15 chance of dropping the Fishron wings. Defeat the Lunatic Cultist. He spawns at the entrance of the dungeon once Golem is defeated. Destroy either the Stardust, Vortex, Nebula, or Solar pillars to get at least 14 fragments. Combine them with 10 Luminite Bars at an Ancient Manipulator to get the Vortex Booster, Stardust Wings, Nebula Mantle, or Solar Wings. Solar Wings are currently the strongest wings in Terraria. This only applies to the PC Version of Terraria. Defeat Plantera and wait for a Solar Eclipse to occur. A large creature named Mothron will rarely spawn and will drop the Mothron Wings. This only applies to the PC Version of Terraria. Defeat bosses while playing Expert Mode. They should drop a Treasure Bag. Rarely, developer reserved wings (such as Will's Wings, Yoraiz0r's Spell, and Skiphs's Paws) can be given. They no longer kill players. This only applies to the PC Version of Terraria.
